Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Merging beta1 change 6811 to trunk to take care of an RTE affecting the performance suite.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
http://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/SDK-20892 - Using navigation keys don’t work when the DropDownList is closed

We have improved keyboard navigation for layouts, but this unfortunately broke keyboard navigation for DropDownList while it is closed. Since neither the layout or the dataGroup is available when the DropDownList is closed, I’ve decided to go back to handling the keyboard navigation directly in DDL. Previously, it had been using List’s keyboard handling (which in turn, relies on layout).

Keyboard navigation now works similar to vertical layout’s keyboard nav. UP and DOWN keys change the selectedIndex up or down. HOME sets selectedIndex to 0. END sets it to the last item. PAGE_UP moves the selectedIndex up 5 spots, while PAGE_DOWN moves it down 5 spots. The page size is defined by an mx_internal static property.
http://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/SDK-20908 - inconsistent naming of "popup" in Spark DropDownList skin
http://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/SDK-20935 - Spark DropDownList button skin should handle line breaks the same as Spark Button skin
QE Notes: Keyboard navigation has changed slightly. PAGE_UP and PAGE_DOWN have slightly different behavior than before.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Add non-committing keyboard selection to DropDownList

Using the keyboard navigation keys no longer immediately changes the selectedIndex. Instead, we store the proposed selectedIndex and update the item renderers. When the dropDown is closed in a committing way, we set the selectedIndex to the proposed selectedIndex.
QE Notes: Update keyboard navigation tests to account for new (correct) behavior
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
SDK-20892 - Using navigation keys don't work when the DropDownList is closed

The dataGroup skin part holds the layout value. The layout was null when the DropDownList was closed because the dataGroup only exists when the DropDownList is open. The fix is to override the layout getter and return VerticalLayout if the dataGroup doesn't exist.
SDK-20850 - DropDownList dispatches open event before dropDown is visible on screen
The skin update was changed from synchronous to asynchronous, so the open event was dispatched too early. We now wait for UPDATE_COMPLETE before sending the open or close events.
SDK-19874 - Setting selectedIndex on Spark DropDownList control doesnt auto-scroll dropdown
The skin update was changed from synchronous to asynchronous, so the dataGroup skin part didn't exist when we tried to auto-scroll. We now wait for UPDATE_COMPLETE before auto-scrolling.
SDK-20810 - DropDownList does not display color style correctly when set to white

The labelElement was getting colorized to the baseColor. The DropDownListSkin has been changed to subclass Skin instead of SparkSkin. There are no visuals in the DropDownListSkin that need any of the SparkSkin functionality.
SDK-20870 - Changing Spark DropDownList skin at runtime clears the DropDownList Button label
In partAdded, when the labelElement is added, we now update the labelElement with the selectedItem's text representation
QE Notes: Fix for SDK-20850 should resolve the image snapshot problem when writing DDL mustella tests.
